intro: Cynoglossum platyphyllum, commonly known as broadleaf bellflower, is a flowering plant belonging to the Boraginaceae family. It is characterized by its broad, oval-shaped leaves and showy, bell-shaped blue or violet flowers. Native to regions of Europe and western Asia, it thrives in well-drained soils and full sun to partial shade. The plant is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes. Its flowers attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies, contributing to ecological biodiversity.
